intro: Rhus schimperi, commonly known as the African sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 meters and has compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in panicles, followed by bright red, spiny fruits that contain several seeds. Rhus schimperi is adapted to well-drained soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a resilient plant in arid environments. It is also known for its potential use in traditional medicine and as a source of tannins.
